content: Does llvm optimizations are running if we set -g flag?

bjorn3 said:

If you also enable optimizations, yes.

How do I find what are the optimizations run, what is the order of optimizations etc, in rust compiler source code?
If we enable debug(-g), how does that affect to optimization pipeline? Does it run as usual?

This function doesn't have a parameter to check if debuginfo is enabled, so I guess it doesn't affect which optimizations run. Enabling debuginfo does result in some changes in the LLVM ir that was emitted in the first place and I believe LLVM itself optimizes a bit less aggressively when debuginfo is present.
